title: 'Today' anchor Hoda Kotb adopts baby girl: 'She is the love of my life'
text:
By Chloe Melas , CNN Updated 1448 GMT (2248 HKT) February 21, 2017 
Chat with us in Facebook Messenger. Find out what's happening in the world as it unfolds. Story highlights 'Today' anchor Hoda Kotb announced Tuesday that she has adopted a baby girl Kotb called in to "Today" to reveal the news along with the little girl's name -- Haley Joy (CNN) Hoda Kotb is a mom. The "Today" co-anchor called in to the show Tuesday with news that she had adopted a baby girl. "I do have something to tell you, but you know what, how about this, instead of telling you, I'm going to show you something," Kotb said as the screen showed a picture of her holding the baby. "That little girl, Haley Joy -- I'm crying -- is my daughter," Kotb continued. "I adopted her, and you can hear her, that's her crying. She's a Valentine's baby. She's a little nugget. She is the love of my life." The "Today" Instagram account posted the picture along with the caption: "Welcome to the family, Haley Joy!" A post shared by TODAY (@todayshow) on Feb 21, 2017 at 5:17am PST Read More Kotb's co-anchor, Kathie Lee Gifford, was on air for the announcement and revealed she had a hard time keeping the news under wraps. "Do you know how hard it has been to keep this secret? I've got the biggest mouth!" Gifford said. This is the first child for Kotb, 52. Follow Us © 2017 Cable News Network.
